title: Trait selection provisional cache incorrectly handles DepNodes, leading to ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Please clone [this repo](https://github.com/znx3p0/canary/tree/1920c7ed65b8181276f06030230dc3c9f8067a22) and build it. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (5531927e8 2021-12-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee commit-date: 2021-12-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (5531927e8 2021-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `routes::Storable: core::marker::Send` #1 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `routes::GLOBAL_ROUTE` is well-formed end of query stack error: could not compile `canary` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/library/core/src/panicking.rs:48:5 3: as rustc_middle::dep_graph::dep_node::DepNodeExt>::extract_def_id 4: rustc_query_impl::query_callbacks::type_of::force_from_dep_node 5: ::try_force_from_dep_node 6: >::try_mark_previous_green:: 7: >::try_mark_previous_green:: 8: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex)>, rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>, core::result::Result>::{closure#2}> 9: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 10: ::evaluate_obligation 11: ::progress_changed_obligations 12: >::process_obligations::> 13: ::select_all_or_error 14: ::select_all_obligations_or_error 15: ::enter::<(), ::enter<::with_fcx::{closure#0}, ()>::{closure#0}> 16: rustc_typeck::check::wfcheck::check_item_type 17: rustc_typeck::check::wfcheck::check_item_well_formed 18: >::with_task:: 19: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<((), rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 20: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 21: ::check_item_well_formed 22: ::par_visit_all_item_likes:: 23: ::track_errors:: 24: rustc_typeck::check_crate 25: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 26: >::with_task::> 27: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 28: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 30: ::enter::> 31: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 32: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 33: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (5531927e8 2021-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `routes::Storable: core::marker::Send` #1 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `routes::GLOBAL_ROUTE` is well-formed #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `canary` ```
